intro: Atractocarpus crosbyi, commonly known as Crosby's sycamore, is a tropical tree native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It belongs to the Moraceae family, which includes figs and mulberries, and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves. The tree produces small, clustered flowers and fruiting structures called syconia, which are typical of the family. It is often found in moist, lowland forests and can reach heights of up to 30 meters. The bark is thick and fissured, providing a rugged appearance.
